page.title: 10Parish Church, Newark
page.content: The Parish Church of St. Mary Magdalene is the third to stand on the site and took 300 years to build being completed in the 16th century. The 240 feet spire dominates the landscape for miles around. The church went into decay in the 17th and 18th centuries and restoration work took place in the 19th century, continuing up to the present day. In the recent 60's an appeal for Â£40,000 was successful and the money was used to restore the exterior stonework and to renew the interior. The churchyard has been made into a public garden where visitors and locals can rest and take in the majesty of this splendid building. The church proves an important tourist attraction for this market town.
